intro: Amphithalea verticillata, commonly known as the spiralwood, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. It is a member of the family Theaceae and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are opposite and often arranged in a helical pattern around the stem, giving it its common name. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators.
